👉 $VZ : Verizon Communications broke out of a base. The stock ended in a buy zone after passing a 55.80 cup-with-handle buy point. The relative strength line has been spiking and could soon clear consolidation highs. Volume on the move was above average, which is a plus. Nevertheless, it was below the ideal volume rise of at least 40% above average on a breakout.
A key reason to exercise caution is that earnings are due before the open tomorrow. An approach is to use options as a strategy to reduce risk around earnings.

👉 $MSFT : Microsoft reports fiscal Q3 results late Tuesday. Analysts predict Microsoft earnings of $2.19 a share, up 12%, on sales of $49 billion, up 17.5%. Earlier this month, Microsoft tumbled after UBS said commercial Office 365 revenue growth might start decelerating, given its high penetration and the fading benefit of the pandemic-related work-from-home trend.
